column2: BrickToken-Fractional Real Estate & Investment Platform
column3: BrickToken is a blockchain-based fractional real estate investment platform that tokenizes properties and gold assets, enabling fractional ownership through Algorand Standard Assets. The platform includes KYC/AML, governance, payment processing, and secondary market trading.

column2: Smart Glass and Smart  Blind Stick For Visually Impaired People
column3: The Smart Glass for Blind Assist System uses a Raspberry Pi 4B, Pi Camera V2, YOLO detection, GPS, and an onboard LLM to describe surroundings. It identifies objects, generates natural-language scene summaries, and announces them through voice output. With real-time AI vision, GPS-based location guidance, and LLM-generated explanations, the system enhances safety, awareness, and independence for visually impaired users.A smart blind stick using Arduino detects obstacles via ultrasonic sensor and water through HW-038, alerting users by vibration and buzzer.

column2: Medicare: Autonomous Multi-Agent Orchestration for Healthcare Data
column3: Medicare addresses the persistent challenge of fragmented healthcare data by implementing an Autonomous Multi-Agent Orchestration framework. Instead of relying on manual entry, our system utilizes specialized AI agents to parse unstructured media, ranging from handwritten prescriptions to complex lab reports and synthesizes them into a unified, queryable database. This architecture supports distinct interfaces for clinicians and patients, allowing doctors to view longitudinal health trends while giving patients granular control over their medical history. The platform’s core interaction layer is MediDoc, a context-aware assistant built on Google Gemini that goes beyond simple Q&A by generating real-time data visualizations and offering voice-enabled accessibility. By integrating these features with Supabase’s Row-Level Security, Medicare creates a secure environment where data accessibility translates directly into more informed clinical decision-making.

column2: Adaptive Spatial-Spectral Denoising of Hyperspectral Images
column3: The aim of the project is to develop a hyperspectral image (HSI) denoising model using deep learning, specifically, convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and natural language processing (NLP) models such as transformers. HSIs are used in downstream applications such as remote sensing and agriculture and are prone to distortions due to envrionmental conditions. In this project, we develop a hybrid architecture comprised of CNNs and transformer to remove the distortions and noise from the HSIs and make them reliably usable in their respictive tasks.

column2: WalkMate - Autonomous Walking Assistant Robot for Visually Impaired People
column3:
WalkMate is an autonomous walking assistant robot designed to help visually impaired individuals navigate their environment safely through real-time object detection and voice-guided assistance. The system employs a dual-controller architecture combining an NVIDIA Jetson Nano for AI-powered visual processing with an Arduino for motor control, enabling seamless autonomous navigation through integrated computer vision, multi-sensor fusion, and audio feedback mechanisms.

The robot utilizes an optimized YOLOv8n object detection model configured for edge computing devices, delivering fast inference times while maintaining high detection accuracy for real-time applications. Through parallel processing of vision-based detection and physical sensor measurements, WalkMate constructs comprehensive environmental awareness that ensures reliable obstacle detection and safe path planning. The system provides intuitive guidance through a voice assistant interface that communicates detected obstacles and navigation instructions to users.

The technical architecture integrates multi-sensor data acquisition, preprocessing and fusion, dual-pipeline processing, distance estimation via bounding box analysis, decision-making logic, and audio output generation. This design balances computational efficiency with performance requirements, optimizing inference speed to ensure practical deployment on embedded systems with limited resources while maintaining the real-time responsiveness essential for safe and effective navigation assistance.

column2: PocketDr Powered by AI: Intelligent Telemedicine and Automated Clinical Documentation System
column3:
PocketDr Powered by AI is a next-generation telemedicine solution where artificial intelligence manages and automates the majority of the clinical consultation process. The platform employs advanced speech recognition, NLP models, and medical AI engines to understand conversations between doctors and patients and then automatically produce prescriptions, diagnoses, visit notes, test suggestions, and follow-up instructions—removing the need for a human assistant. AI-based facial recognition replaces traditional login methods, enabling elderly and rural patients to access their health records effortlessly.

In addition, the system’s AI capabilities include early symptom triage, detection of potentially conflicting medications, emergency risk alerts, and intelligent noise reduction during video consultations. The AI engine dynamically adjusts to low-bandwidth networks to ensure stable communication in remote areas. Prescriptions are generated in both Bangla and English using AI-powered translation. PocketDr also incorporates AI-assisted scheduling, Pay-Later risk assessment, and automated medical history summaries to help doctors make quicker and more informed decisions.

With AI positioned at the core of documentation, decision support, communication, and user interaction, PocketDr seeks to transform telemedicine in Bangladesh by making expert healthcare more accessible, efficient, and affordable for underserved rural communities.

column2: A Smart System Framework Leveraging Community Enterprise for Fair-Price Discovery and Market Stability
column3: This project addresses critical market inefficiencies in Bangladesh’s rice sector, including price volatility, middlemen exploitation, and farmer income insecurity. We propose a digital framework centered on community enterprise approach (CEA) to empower farmers. We develop an integrated system model featuring two core components: a Yield Prediction Simulator that models total production of each farmer based on their region and land size, and a Fair Price Estimator. The estimator employs a “Living Income” methodology to calculate a minimum viable price for farmers, ensuring production costs and basic living needs are met, plus a justifiable profit margin. The whole supply and value chain will be kept transparent to ensure a Fair Consumer Price, balancing the welfare of both producers and consumers. By moving beyond the impractical elimination of middlemen to instead increase market competition and transparency, our framework provides cooperatives through community enterprises with enhanced bargaining power. The initial development of a prototype confirms the technical feasibility, paving the way for a practical application that can reduce exploitation, stabilize markets, and promote sustainable agricultural livelihoods.

column2: NeuroVision: 3D Brain Tumor Segmentation with a Dual-Stage Enhanced GAN-Based Transformer Architecture and Temporal Growth Prediction Using Ensemble Learning
column3: This project introduces an advanced AI approach that can be used for automatic brain tumor segmentation, forecasting future tumor growth, and displays results through interactive 3D visualization. Its uniqueness comes from combining a two-stage GAN with Swin Transformer and residual attention for highly accurate 3D segmentation, along with an ensemble model for precise temporal forecasting. The entire pipeline runs through a web application, which makes it practical for real clinical workflows. Providing fast analysis, clear views of tumor progression, and reliable predictions. This system supports doctors, enhances patient understanding, and shows substantial real-world value in modern healthcare.

column2: Cross-Script Knowledge Distillation for Bangla NLP: Transliteration-Driven Compression of Large Transformer Models
column3: This work investigates cross-lingual transfer into Bangla and introduces an efficient cross-script knowledge distillation (KD) framework for compact Bangla NLP models. We first benchmark XLM-R on POS tagging, dependency parsing, and sentiment analysis, showing extremely low zero-shot performance and large gains from English and Indo-Aryan supervision. Motivated by these findings, we propose a transliteration-driven MiniLM-style KD pipeline that bridges Bangla–Latin script mismatch and enables effective compression of large Bangla-capable teachers into lightweight students. Our method improves sentiment precision by up to 1.8% over shared-tokenizer KD and produces models with 40–50% reduced compute while retaining over 95% of teacher accuracy, making it practical for deployment.

column2: Blockchain based Know Your Customer (KYC) Platform
column3:
Our project is built to combat the tedious bureaucracy the banks face when onboarding new customers. The solution that we are providing through our system is two folds. 
1) We are making the KYC process automated (maintaining Bangladesh KYC Policy) instead of the usual manual way the banks are conducting their KYC workflow, 
2) We are integrating blockchain so that the data of customers stay private unless the customer consents to give and also banks can get hold of the status of the customer if they are eligible for onboarding or not. 
These two points are foundational for our claim of presenting our system as a uniform KYC solution for all the banks that will partner up.

column2: General Purpose Humanoid Robot with imitation learning and reinforcement learning
column3: We are working with robotic arms implemented with Arduino Mega 2560 as microcontrollers . We will also connect those with a humanoid body . We have done BC and designed a agentic system to control the robot .

column2: EasyTalk – An Automated Bangla Voice-To-Sign and Text-To-Sign Translation System for Non-Verbal Communication with 2000 Bangla Sign Word Level Dataset
column3: In our country, we have a large number of people who are hearing-impaired. They find it really hard when it comes to express their thoughts to general population. This communication barrier between hearing-impaired community and general population in our country is very significant. My project “EasyTalk – An Automated Bangla Voice-To-Sign and Text-To-Sign Translation System for Non-Verbal Communication with 2000 Bangla Sign Word Level Dataset” is designed to bridge the gap between the two communities. This system is designed to translate both Bangla text and speech into continuous Bangla Sign Language. It has 2000 words pre-recorded Bangla sign language videos, which is currently the largest Bangla word level sign dataset. The dataset is mapped to sign lexicon of Bangla words. In the system, we have implemented Google Speech Recognition API to convert Bangla Spoken Language into text in real-time with an accuracy of 94.45% for quiet environment and 92.37% for Noisy environment and Natural Language Processing (NLP) for tokenizing texts in the user input sentences. Suffix Stripping algorithm has been used to strip the suffixes (e.g., " "গুলো", "টি") from the Bangla words with an 100% accuracy and then mapped to the mapping.csv file. I have implemented MediaPipe Holistic, which overlays skeletal landmarks on the output videos. The accuracy of landmark extraction is 84.2% for hands and 100% for pose. Using FFmpeg concatenation, the output videos are then merged together to output the final Bangla Sign Video sequentially. This project gains a high accuracy in terms of voice recognition and smooth video transition using FFmpeg concatenation.

column2: Pathora: AI-Powered Career Guidance and Adaptive Skill Evaluation System
column3: This project presents an AI-driven Career Guidance System that combines user preferences with real job-market data to generate personalized, time-feasible learning plans for Software Engineering and Data Analyst roles. It uses a unique multi-stage dual-LLM pipeline with an adaptive skill-evaluation module, achieving high evaluation scores (9.44–9.78/10) and outperforming a ChatGPT-5.1 application.

column2: Explainable Egocentric Action Forecasting via Graph Neuro-Symbolic Reasoning using Open-Vocabulary Noun Cues
column3: This work develops an explainable egocentric action forecasting framework that predicts what a head-mounted camera wearer will do next. We first use an open-vocabulary object detector to extract noun cues (e.g., egg, pan, knife) and build a graph over detected objects and hands. A graph neural network (GNN) predicts future actions, verbs, and nouns in a closed label space. On top of this, a neuro-symbolic reasoning layer applies intuitive rules over the nouns (e.g., egg + pan => cooking actions) to guide predictions and generate interpretable, text-based explanations, evaluated through experiments and ablation studies on egocentric video datasets.

column2: A Drone-Based Deep Learning Approach for Real-Time Pest and Weed Detection
column3: In this work, we propose a real-time detection pipeline based on UAV imagery. Our applied model for weeds and pests results show that on the MH-Weed16 (15 classes) dataset, YOLOv8x gives mAP (71%), and on the Insect Benchmark (9 classes) dataset, YOLOv9 gives a higher mAP (91%). We have innovatively incorporated the multi-head mechanism into the backbone of YOLOv8x to perform simultaneous detection, achieving results almost as good as those of our single model. Finally, we have deployed the best model on a Raspberry Pi 4, along with a Pi Camera and a drone to take real-time images.

column2: AIRIS
column3: AI-powered real-time vision system for the visually impaired.

column2: PANDA : Personalized ADHD Neuro Diagnostic Assesment
column3:
The PANDA (Personalized ADHD Neuro Diagnostic Assessment) is an AI-powered conversational agent designed to support early ADHD screening in children through natural, empathetic dialogue with parents or caregivers. Unlike conventional questionnaires, PANDA conducts adaptive conversations while systematically assessing 27 validated symptom indicators across four domains: oppositional/defiant behavior, cognitive inattention, hyperactivity/impulsivity, and overall ADHD presentation. It also screens for autism-related traits to improve differential assessment.
Built through iterative development involving advanced prompt engineering, chain-of-thought reasoning, and real-time internal symptom tracking, PANDA produces a transparent overall ADHD likelihood score at the end of each session, accompanied by a clear, caregiver-friendly summary of key findings.
An optional voice interface enhances accessibility for users who prefer spoken interaction. By lowering barriers to initial screening and delivering structured, evidence-based insights, PANDA aims to facilitate earlier identification of ADHD risk and empower families and clinicians with actionable information for timely professional evaluation.

column2: A Simple and Lightweight Inverse AI Technique to Enhance the Performance of Metamaterial Absorbers
column3: This research explores the use of inverse machine learning technology to accelerate and enhance the design of a metasurface absorber. While CST simulation alone requires days or even months of iterative trials to identify optimal parameters—making the process highly time-consuming and computationally expensive—we address this challenge using an inverse ML approach. In this method, forward and backward models work together sequentially: the forward model learns how structural parameters affect absorption, and the backward model predicts the parameter sets needed for improved performance. We first design and simulate a meta-absorber in CST to collect absorption data across wavelengths. This data is used to train the inverse machine learning model that learns the relationship between structural parameters and absorption performance. The model then predicts new parameter sets that maximize absorbance in longer-wavelength regions. When these predicted parameters are re-tested in CST, the absorber shows significant improvement. The results demonstrate that inverse machine learning can dramatically reduce design time while guiding the development of high-performance meta-absorbers.

column2: Voice Controlled Robot Pet Car with LLM and Vision Integration
column3: This project demonstrates a Voice-Controlled Intelligent Robot Pet Car that can interpret natural-language orders, navigate independently, and engage with users via conversational AI.  The system accepts commands via a microphone-based voice interface, which are processed by an ASR (Automatic Speech Recognition) module and interpreted by an LLM for natural conversation and task understanding.  A front-facing camera paired with real-time computer vision allows the robot to identify obstructions, avoid collisions, and dynamically adjust its direction. The car, created as an interactive robotic companion, can move, turn, obey commands, and answer conversationally, making it both a functional autonomous vehicle and an engaging "pet-like" robot with adaptive intelligence.

column2: AGENTIC TRAVEL ASSISTANT WITH MULT-PHASE PLANNING
column3: This project presents an AI-powered travel assistant that enables users to search flights, hotels, events, and destination news through voice and text interaction. Utilizing LangGraph's ReAct agent pattern, the system extracts user intent, generates personalized itineraries, and performs background price monitoring ,unifying the travel planning experience.

column2: LipMotion Studio
column3:
LipMotion Studio is a full-stack application that enables users to create product/accessory advertisements using their own / given avatars. 

The application provides a workflow for the users to upload an image (user image or default image from the application) with showcasing a product/accessory on hand, to change or modify the product/accessory through AI, to edit/modify the overall image, to produce a reacting video of advertising the product/accessory from that edited image without a speech, and finally, to provide text and speech into AI model for text-to-speech alignment along with lip synchronization for that video.

The purpose of the project is to create advertisement videos featuring any avatar images (User Image, AI Image, or realistic influencer image) for a given product/accessory, and to reduce the workload and infrastructure costs associated with creating advertisements for a product shown in media/TV.

column2: Coordinated Drone Swarms for Precision Agriculture, Fisheries and Drone Show Applications
column3: The project presents a coordinated multi-drone system designed for precision agriculture, fisheries management, and drone show applications. Using dual GPS modules, each drone operates collaboratively to perform automated tasks such as field monitoring and resource distribution. The system demonstrates how swarm coordination can minimize labor, improve efficiency, and boost sustainability in rural sectors. Results offer a  platform for future breakthroughs in smart farming, autonomous fishery operations, and scalable aerial entertainment systems.

column2: PNEUMA - Perceptual Noesis for Episodic Universal Memory Architecture
column3: PNEUMA is a model-agnostic long-term video understanding and memory system, storing egocentric perception through a multilayer hierarchical architecture integrating SQL, FAISS, and knowledge graphs on consumer hardware.

column2: AinGPT: AI-Driven Bengali Legal Platform for Users and Legal Professionals
column3:
In this project, we have developed an integrated digital platform that connects lawyers with clients and supports both sides throughout the legal process. The platform features three advanced AI-powered chat systems trained on DLR and other relevant legal documents to assist users and lawyers with their legal inquiries. We have manually collected legal data from DLR books available in the library by scanning them and converting the content into embeddings, ensuring high-quality, locally relevant legal knowledge.

Clients can open cases, get matched with suitable lawyers, and communicate with them directly through secure chat. They can also use the AI chatbot to explore possible solutions and access our “Legal Learn” section to understand laws and key legal concepts in simple language.

From the lawyer’s side, the platform offers a centralized dashboard to manage all their cases, discover new client cases, and communicate efficiently with clients. Lawyers can leverage the AI assistant to quickly retrieve case-specific information, complete with relevant sources and references. For complex and critical matters, we provide an enhanced feature called Legal Council, where multiple large language models collaborate and debate internally to propose an optimized legal strategy or solution, ensuring more reliable and well-rounded support.
